message.raw:
Separated filtergraph generation for trim + atrim, scale + pad, pan + volume
filters into three separate functions: silenceFilterGraph, resizeFilterGraph, &
panGainAudioGraph. This allowed making the stereo panning & gain both optional.
These are all called by generateFilterGraph, but can be used in isolation.
message.html:
Separated filtergraph generation for trim + atrim, scale + pad, pan + volume
filters into three separate functions: silenceFilterGraph, resizeFilterGraph, &
panGainAudioGraph. This allowed making the stereo panning & gain both optional.
These are all called by generateFilterGraph, but can be used in isolation.

message.raw:
* Moved *heaps* of implementation code (in __main__) into functions:
  ffprobe, findDuration, getDuration, findSampleRate, getSampleRate, getSilences,
  getLoudness, writeFilterGraph, ffmpegComplexFilter.

* Now all ffmpeg and ffprobe calls are made in these functions, and in __main__
variables are only defined if they are required for a subsequent function call
or for printing statistics/debug information.

* Added trimSegments to trim multiple segments from an input.

* Wrote docstrings for all but generateFilterGraph and writeFilterGraph.

* Made OS independent by replacing NUL (Windows) with os.devnull.

* Renamed script to autoscrub.
message.html:
• Moved heaps of implementation code (in main) into functions:
    ffprobe, findDuration, getDuration, findSampleRate, getSampleRate, getSilences,
    getLoudness, writeFilterGraph, ffmpegComplexFilter.

  • Now all ffmpeg and ffprobe calls are made in these functions, and in main
    variables are only defined if they are required for a subsequent function call
    or for printing statistics/debug information.

  • Added trimSegments to trim multiple segments from an input.

  • Wrote docstrings for all but generateFilterGraph and writeFilterGraph.

  • Made OS independent by replacing NUL (Windows) with os.devnull.

  • Renamed script to autoscrub.

* Now all ffmpeg and ffprobe calls are made in these functions, and in __main__

    ffprobe, findDuration, getDuration, findSampleRate, getSampleRate, getSilences,

  • Now all ffmpeg and ffprobe calls are made in these functions, and in main

values.message:
* Moved *heaps* of implementation code (in __main__) into functions:
  ffprobe, findDuration, getDuration, findSampleRate, getSampleRate, getSilences,
  getLoudness, writeFilterGraph, ffmpegComplexFilter.

* Now all ffmpeg and ffprobe calls are made in these functions, and in __main__
variables are only defined if they are required for a subsequent function call
or for printing statistics/debug information.

* Added trimSegments to trim multiple segments from an input.

* Wrote docstrings for all but generateFilterGraph and writeFilterGraph.

* Made OS independent by replacing NUL (Windows) with os.devnull.

* Renamed script to autoscrub.

message.raw:
Working implementation of auto scrub (Camtasia *.trec --> YouTube *.mp4). Notes:
Scripted processing (Python + ffmpeg) of Camtasia recording made on a
Surface Pro 4 with a Focusrite Solo USB sound card and a Sennheiser ew100 G3
wireless mic.

Inputs:
* Sennheiser transmitter gain: -15dB
* Sennheiser reciever AF out: 0dB
* Focusrite pre-amp gain (microphone input, left channel): 5/10
* Windows recording volume: 100%
* Audio format: 44.1kHz, 16 bit, stereo (signal only on left channel)
* Recorded resolution: 2736x1824 (full screen)
* Frame rate: 30fps

Processing (not in order):
* Pan left channel to both left and right
* Loudness measurement using ebur128 filter
* Gain modified (using volume filter) to reach integrated loudness of -18 LUFS
* Silence detection: -18dB threshold (minimum 2 seconds), and a 0.25 sec buffer
* Speed up video during silences by 8x
* Sample only first 1/8th of silence interval without resampling or speed change
* Rescale video to fit 1920 x 1080 display (pillarbox or letterbox as required)
* Convert trec to streamable format as specified by YouTube
